content: AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Section 8335a of title 5, United States Code, states that Members of Congress will no longer be covered by the retirement system, and no further contributions will be made to their accounts. Members of Congress will no longer be covered by the retirement system, and no further contributions will be made to their accounts after the date of enactment. This change does not affect any rights or benefits accrued prior to this date. Members of Congress will no longer receive contributions to their retirement accounts after the date of enactment. This change does not impact any rights or benefits accrued prior to this date. Additionally, eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations may be implemented to enforce this section. Members of Congress will no longer receive contributions to their retirement accounts after the date of enactment. This change does not impact any rights or benefits accrued prior to this date. Eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations may be implemented to enforce this section. Personnel Management regulations, excluding matters related to the Thrift Savings Plan, will be determined by the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress. Amendments related to the Federal Employees' Retirement System. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress. Amendment to chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code, to end further retirement coverage for Members of Congress. After the date of enactment, Members of Congress will no longer be subject to retirement coverage under this chapter. No further Government contributions or deductions will be made for Members who have completed at least 5 years of service. After completing 5 years of service, Members of Congress will no longer receive Government contributions or deductions for retirement coverage. New Members will not be subject to this chapter. After 5 years of service, Members of Congress will no longer receive Government contributions or deductions for retirement coverage. New Members will not be subject to this chapter and no contributions will be made to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund for them. This does not affect any prior rights. After 5 years of service, Members of Congress will no longer receive Government contributions or deductions for retirement coverage. Contributions from basic pay may be deposited in the Treasury of the United States to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. This does not affect any prior rights or eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan.
